title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: South Park Elementary. The school bell rings. Most of the third-grade boys are in a shop room.

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: This is shop class.  My name is Mr. Adler. For the next week, rather than your normal schoolwork, you'll be learning how to make things. Now, does anybody know WHY you're in shop class?  Yes?

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: Because we had to choose between this and home ec, and we didn't wanna be sissies?

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: Wrong! You are here because you are America's future!  You may someday be doctors, or lawyers, or scientists. Most of you, however, will be pumping gas, or cutting sheet metal, and that's why we have...  shop class.

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: Ooooohh.

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: Now, let me make one thing crystal clear: I don't like kids that screw around! You screw around in shop class, you can lose a hand or an eye. I have a- I have... uh, I have a...

text: Mr. Adler?

text: Huh? Oh, uh, I was just saying that I want to know who is the biggest troublemaker in your class?

text: Well, your cooking is unsatisfactory, your sewing skills are below average, and, frankly, I don't think the odds of you marrying a nice rich man in the future are very, well, good.

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: (You don't?)

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: No. I think you should consider transfering to shop class.

text: (Shop class?)  (No, I won't!)

text: Now, now. Very few students are severely innured in a shop class.

text: The spirit of the dragon is in your hands. Hurshar kashurshar. Hurlong churshar. All right?

text: Okay.

text: Now, LISTEN to me! Hurlong kashurshar! All right?! And seriously: Hurlong kepur shung kwong!

text: Good-bye, cruel world.  Jesus Christ! What was I thinking?! That would have hurt like hell!

text: the playground. Craig and Tweek tumble towards the school, neither giving in. The other kids follow them to a clearing outside a bungalow, where Caraig and Tweek resume trading punches

text: Huh?

text: Shop Class. Kenny starts cutting wood on the jigsaw, but looks at Mr. Adler going to his death. Craig and Tweek crash through the shop class window and continue fighting

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: What the-?

text: Here they are.

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: Hey! What's going on?

text: Tweek and Craig are fighting. We're just watching.

text: Well, why the hell don't you stop them?

text: 'Cause we have ten bucks riding on it.

text: Don't screw aROUND!

text: (Hey!)  (Hey!)

text: Stop screwin' aROUND!!

text: Tweek slams Craig into a second jigsaw and both tumble into a tool cart, which falls onto the second jigsaw, which tumbles onto the one Kenny is on.

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: (Hey, God damnit!)

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: Eh. Hey, you're SCREWIN' AROUND TOO MUCH!!

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: (Ugh!)

text: Oh my God, they killed Kenny!

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: You bastards!

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: Well, don't just stand there, call an ambulance!  You see? You see what happens when you screw around in shop class?

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: (I understand, dude.)

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: What? What's that, son?

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: Richard.

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: AAaaagh!  No! No, please don't go. I need you. I can't live without you.

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: Richard, you have to move on. I want you to be happy.

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: But I can't. I never got a chance to say good-bye.

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: Then say it now, Richard.

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: Good-bye?

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: There. Now do you feel better?

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: No.

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: Of course you don't. Saying good-bye doesn't mean anything. It's the time that we spent together that really matters, not how we loved it.

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: You... you're right. You're right.

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: Richard, this is Grandma.

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: Gram'ma? Hi, Gram!

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: You never said good-bye to me either.

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: Hey, Richard. Remember me?

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: Uncle Corey! Wow, you're all alive again!

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: No! We're dead!

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: I love you, Richard. See you soon.

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: Thank you. Thank you for freeing me. I feel like now I can move on. Baby, I feel so much better. I feel so alive. Thank you, baby. Thank you.

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: Dude, this is pretty fucked up right here.

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: Hell's Pass Hospital. The kids enter. Stan approaches a nurse

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: Hi. We're here to visit our good friends, Tweek and Craig.

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: Oh. Well, I suppose a quick visit is okay. Maybe you kids can cheer them up.

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: Hey, you guys. How are you feeling?

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: Rrr!

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: Ugh.

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: Well, uh. We just came by because we have something to tell you.

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: Yeah. See, we got you to fight just 'cause we wanted to see who was the toughest. We made up all that stuff we said to get you guys mad at each other.

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: Yes. You can flip us off, Craig. We deserve that. We just came by to apologize. We feel so bad.

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: Boy, do we ever.

title: TWEEK VS CRAIG
text: So I guess we'll be gong now, and live with the knowledge that... you're both kind of sissies.

text: What?!

text: Well, I mean, that's what was on the news.

text: What was on the news?

text: Oh, you didn't see it? Oh. Tweek's family was on the news saying what a wuss youare, Craig.

text: Huh?

text: Yeah. And then Craig's family came on and said Tweek was the wuss, and then punched Tweek's mom in the hooters.

text: Uuh! You son of a bitch!

text: I'm gonna kick you ass!
